to pull or tear something away, especially a part of the body as a result of an accident or surgery: Ingrown toenails may need to be avulsed. the reimplantation of avulsed teeth Related word
avulsion
More examplesFewer examplesIf you pull, you can avulse the muscle in the ventricle.With steady traction using forceps the lesion was avulsed from its origin.Care should be taken not to avulse the obturator vessels. Surgical treatment is generally recommended when the avulsed bone fragments are displaced.
